column4: is it possible to get TS for W2K (it's not installed right now AFAICT)
pgrep is cool - never heard of that before
pkill seems to work more consistently than killall I've found recently too
I use nvidia's drivers, but the debs are supposed to be fine
did you follow the 'BinaryDriverHowto' on the wiki?
no, I've been using nvidia drivers for a long time, so I just did it the way I've always done it.
can you tell me how you did it, or give hints/pointers?
I installed the kernel headers (sudo apt-get install linux-headers-`uname -r`), downloaded the drivers from nvidia's site, and said sudo sh NVIDIA*
OK, so you installed the official nvidia drivers, not the DEBs
alright, I'll have a look at that option then - tx
it's easier to use the debs, though.
I'm sure it is, but those are not working for me, as I mentioned
